# Incident Response

## Overview

<!-- Describe the incident response process for {{repoName}}. -->

## Severity Levels

| Level | Name | Description | Response Time |
|-------|------|-------------|---------------|
| SEV-1 | Critical | Complete service outage | <!-- e.g. 15 minutes --> |
| SEV-2 | Major | Significant degradation | <!-- e.g. 30 minutes --> |
| SEV-3 | Minor | Limited impact, workaround available | <!-- e.g. 4 hours --> |
| SEV-4 | Low | Cosmetic or minor issue | <!-- e.g. Next business day --> |

## Incident Workflow

1. **Detect** — Alert fires or user reports an issue.
2. **Triage** — Assign severity and incident commander.
3. **Communicate** — Notify stakeholders via designated channel.
4. **Mitigate** — Apply immediate fix or rollback.
5. **Resolve** — Confirm service restored to normal.
6. **Postmortem** — Document root cause and action items.

## Roles

| Role | Responsibility |
|------|---------------|
| Incident Commander | Coordinates response and communication |
| Technical Lead | Diagnoses and implements fix |
| Communications Lead | Updates stakeholders and status page |

## Communication Channels

- **War room:** <!-- e.g. Slack #incidents -->
- **Status page:** <!-- e.g. https://status.example.com -->
- **Escalation:** <!-- e.g. PagerDuty rotation -->

## Postmortem Template

After each SEV-1 or SEV-2 incident, complete a postmortem covering:

- Timeline of events
- Root cause analysis
- Action items with owners and due dates
